text:
Anyone else getting an error they don't have access to HubSpot projects? I have a react frontend for website and then the app backend in my project and everything deployed fined untill I added in an extensions folder and added an extension in

```✖ Failed to upload midab-application project files to mid-atlantic-builders (22512037)
[ERROR] The current target account 22512037 does not have access to HubSpot projects. To opt in to the CRM Development Beta and use projects, visit <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/whats-new/betas?productUpdateId=13860216>.```
Yeah, this happens if you didn't join the beta for the CRM UI Extension.

So for extensions to work you have to join your portal in the Beta. Then you'll have a new tab in the menu CRM Development where you'll see all your projects (including the cms-react). It's a bit weird that this isn't required for cms-react but it is for the extension part.
But clicking this url doesnt return any beta, looks like as if it was removed or something
Opens the sidebar for a second and then instantly closes it

I've updated the CLI to 5.1.4-beta.1 and not I get this

```✖ Failed to upload midab-application project files to mid-atlantic-builders (22512037)
[ERROR] The post in account 22512037 failed.```
To join the beta you have to get in the HubSpot account -> Product Updates and search for CRM development. Should look something like this
Uploads!! thank you:raised_hands:

Having an issue with deploying a UI Extension to a client’s portal - is there a restriction on Partner Admins? Works fine on any portal where I have Super Admin access:
```[ERROR] Unable to create app. Error: com.HubSpot.apicaller.exceptions.ApiFailure: Api[name=oauth-api-caller-client, httpMethod=POST, subPath=v2/private-apps] Failed to process your request. Error code was '403'. Error message was:
{"status":"USER_UNAUTHORIZED","message":"user does not have permissions to authorize scopes","correlationId":"a442323e-3613-4a77-b3e5-3bdfc2930a89"}```
Managed to get it working after gaining Super Admin on the same portal - not sure if this is a bug or by design? <@U04EJHVD8FM>

Hey <@U03FJQPSC0Y>, could you maybe confirm this assumption ? Just wanna be sure of what this migration implies :wink:
Thanks a lot!

<@U05KNCMAE7N>
I encountered similar challenges as <@U01AHCQ7EJC>, but eventually, everything fell into place and it all worked out. :slightly_smiling_face:.
Thank you guys .

Anyone know how to serve a local .png file to the Image component? I've tried typing the address to the png various ways but my suspicion is that it isn't set up to serve local files from my newly created images directory.
Anyone know how to accomplish this? Was handed the ask this morning and naively said it should take me no time. Immediately ran into this issue. It's just a simple logo at the top of the app.
Doing something like this currently:
```<Image src='/extensions/images/logo1.png' alt='logo' width='100'></Image>```
request: allow us to hide the "Powered by...." text
<@U05CAJG8D98> saw your earlier post was this resolved?
Yes, resolved. When is this going to come out of beta/be production ready?
Try using path to find the public url, if not just upload it to the file manger and referance that
The CLI?
Possible HubSpots build pipeline extracts images somewhere, maybe try using requiere instead of relative path
The crm customization in general
Im guessing updating the cli is part of that yeah hah
We'll likely make an official release of the CLI in the next several weeks after we finish testing / QA the updates
we dont yet have a definitive timeline for GA of CRM customizations
Is this then safe to use for production or can we expect major changes like the deprecation of v1 was?
Ye so its most likely their build pipeline excracting this out. I know having tailwind in cms react had a similar issue
